document_data.name: The Fool's Altar
document_data.mainbody: '''The Fool's Altar''' was a small shrine dedicated to [[Finder Wyvernspur]], the Nameless Bard, located in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The Fool's Altar stood just south of [[Ascloakan's Fine Inn]], along [[Hammaskarl's Ride]], a street that began at the city's easternmost gate—the [[Basilisk Gate]]—and curved south then ran north
document_data.History: The shrine was tended by a [[finhead]] [[saurial]] [[cleric]] named [[Aszloakh the Hooded]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], who was known for his patience, calm, and cynical good humor.{{Cite web/theedverse/2023-07-02 - Aszloakh the Hooded}}
